class ContainerSyncJob < ApplicationJob
  queue_as :default

  def perform
    Sandbox.active.where.not(container_id: nil).find_each do |sandbox|
      sync_sandbox(sandbox)
    end

    User.where(tailscale_state: [ "enabled", "pending" ]).find_each do |user|
      sync_tailscale_sidecar(user)
    end

    begin
      RouteManager.new.sync_all_configs
    rescue => e
      Rails.logger.error("ContainerSyncJob: route sync failed: #{e.message}")
    end

    begin
      TerminalManager.new.cleanup_orphaned
    rescue => e
      Rails.logger.error("ContainerSyncJob: terminal cleanup failed: #{e.message}")
    end
  end

  private

  def sync_sandbox(sandbox)
    container = Docker::Container.get(sandbox.container_id)
    state = container.json["State"] || {}
    actual_status = if state["Restarting"]
      "stopped"
    elsif state["Running"]
      "running"
    else
      "stopped"
    end

    if sandbox.status != actual_status
      if actual_status == "stopped"
        begin
          TerminalManager.new.close(sandbox: sandbox)
        rescue TerminalManager::Error, Docker::Error::DockerError
          # best-effort
        end
      end
      sandbox.update!(status: actual_status)
      Rails.logger.info("ContainerSyncJob: #{sandbox.full_name} status corrected to #{actual_status}")
    end
  rescue Docker::Error::NotFoundError
    begin
      TerminalManager.new.close(sandbox: sandbox)
    rescue TerminalManager::Error, Docker::Error::DockerError
      # best-effort
    end
    sandbox.update!(status: "destroyed", container_id: nil)
    Rails.logger.warn("ContainerSyncJob: #{sandbox.full_name} container gone, marked destroyed")
  end

  def sync_tailscale_sidecar(user)
    return if user.tailscale_container_id.blank?

    Docker::Container.get(user.tailscale_container_id)
  rescue Docker::Error::NotFoundError
    user.update!(tailscale_state: "disabled", tailscale_container_id: nil, tailscale_network: nil)
    user.sandboxes.active.where(tailscale: true).update_all(tailscale: false)
    Rails.logger.warn("ContainerSyncJob: Tailscale sidecar for #{user.name} gone, marked disabled")
  end
end

content.thinking:
Perfect! I can see that the `ContainerSyncJob` already handles stale container IDs. Looking at lines 50-57:

```ruby
rescue Docker::Error::NotFoundError
  begin
    TerminalManager.new.close(sandbox: sandbox)
  rescue TerminalManager::Error, Docker::Error::DockerError
    # best-effort
  end
  sandbox.update!(status: "destroyed", container_id: nil)
  Rails.logger.warn("ContainerSyncJob: #{sandbox.full_name} container gone, marked destroyed")
end
```

So the sync job will detect containers that no longer exist and mark them as destroyed. However, this job only runs every 5 minutes (as noted in the CLAUDE.md).

The issue is that in the TerminalManager#connect_sandbox_to_network method (line 152-162), when it tries to get the container, it will fail with NotFoundError if the container doesn't exist. This error is caught by the rescue on line 36, but it's too late - the user already sees the error.

The better solution is to handle this case more gracefully in the `connect_sandbox_to_network` method itself. We should catch the NotFoundError and either:
1. Skip connecting (if the container doesn't exist, we can't connect it anyway)
2. Or raise a more specific error that we can handle upstream

Actually, looking more carefully at the issue - the problem is that the sandbox has `status: "running"` in the database but the container doesn't exist. The `open` method checks on line 12:

```ruby
raise Error, "Sandbox is not running" unless sandbox.status == "running"
```

So the sandbox is marked as "running" in the DB, but the actual container is gone. This is the stale state that ContainerSyncJob is supposed to fix.

The immediate fix is to make the `connect_sandbox_to_network` method more resilient by catching NotFoundError:

The fix is to handle the missing container gracefully in `connect_sandbox_to_network`:

class TerminalManager
  DATA_DIR = ENV.fetch("SANDCASTLE_DATA_DIR", "/data")
  WETTY_IMAGE = ENV.fetch("SANDCASTLE_WETTY_IMAGE", "wettyoss/wetty:latest")
  NETWORK_NAME = "sandcastle-web"
  DYNAMIC_DIR = File.join(DATA_DIR, "traefik", "dynamic")

  class Error < StandardError; end

  # Opens a web terminal for the given sandbox.
  # Returns the URL path to the WeTTY session.
  def open(sandbox:)
    raise Error, "Sandbox is not running" unless sandbox.status == "running"
    raise Error, "Sandbox has no container" if sandbox.container_id.blank?

    user = sandbox.user
    container_name = wetty_container_name(sandbox)

    # Idempotent: if WeTTY container already running, return URL
    if container_running?(container_name)
      return wetty_url(sandbox)
    end

    pull_image
    ensure_network
    connect_sandbox_to_network(sandbox)

    # Write Traefik config early so it has time to detect the new route
    # while we set up keypairs and start the WeTTY container.
    write_traefik_config(sandbox)

    key_dir = generate_keypair(sandbox)
    inject_pubkey(sandbox, key_dir)
    create_wetty_container(sandbox: sandbox, user: user, key_dir: key_dir)

    wetty_url(sandbox)
  rescue Docker::Error::DockerError => e
    raise Error, "Failed to open terminal: #{e.message}"
  rescue SystemCallError => e
    raise Error, "Failed to open terminal: #{e.message}"
  end

  # Closes the web terminal for the given sandbox.
  def close(sandbox:)
    container_name = wetty_container_name(sandbox)

    # Stop and remove WeTTY container
    begin
      container = Docker::Container.get(container_name)
      container.stop(t: 3) rescue nil
      container.delete(force: true)
    rescue Docker::Error::NotFoundError
      # Already gone
    end

    # Delete Traefik config
    delete_traefik_config(sandbox)

    # Clean up key directory
    key_dir = key_dir_path(sandbox)
    FileUtils.rm_rf(key_dir)

    # Best-effort: remove pubkey from sandbox authorized_keys
    remove_pubkey(sandbox)
  rescue Docker::Error::DockerError => e
    Rails.logger.error("TerminalManager: close failed for #{sandbox.full_name}: #{e.message}")
  end

  # Returns true if the WeTTY container is running for this sandbox.
  def active?(sandbox:)
    container_running?(wetty_container_name(sandbox))
  end

  # Removes orphaned WeTTY containers whose sandbox no longer exists or is not running.
  def cleanup_orphaned
    Docker::Container.all(all: true).each do |container|
      name = container.info.dig("Names")&.first&.delete_prefix("/")
      next unless name&.start_with?("sc-wetty-")

      labels = container.info["Labels"] || {}
      sandbox_id = labels["sandcastle.sandbox_id"]&.to_i

      sandbox = sandbox_id ? Sandbox.find_by(id: sandbox_id) : nil
      should_remove = sandbox.nil? || sandbox.status != "running"

      if should_remove
        container.stop(t: 3) rescue nil
        container.delete(force: true)
        Rails.logger.info("TerminalManager: removed orphaned WeTTY container #{name}")

        # Clean up Traefik config and keys if we have a sandbox_id
        if sandbox_id
          config_path = File.join(DYNAMIC_DIR, "terminal-#{sandbox_id}.yml")
          File.delete(config_path) if File.exist?(config_path)
        end

        # Extract full_name from container name and validate format
        full_name = name.delete_prefix("sc-wetty-")
        unless full_name.match?(/\A[a-z][a-z0-9_-]+-[a-z][a-z0-9_-]*\z/)
          Rails.logger.warn("TerminalManager: skipping suspicious container name: #{name}")
          next
        end

        key_dir = File.join(DATA_DIR, "wetty", full_name)
        expected_parent = File.join(DATA_DIR, "wetty")
        unless File.expand_path(key_dir).start_with?("#{File.expand_path(expected_parent)}/")
          Rails.logger.warn("TerminalManager: path traversal attempt detected: #{key_dir}")
          next
        end

        FileUtils.rm_rf(key_dir) if Dir.exist?(key_dir)
      end
    end
  rescue Docker::Error::DockerError => e
    Rails.logger.error("TerminalManager: orphan cleanup failed: #{e.message}")
  end

  private

  def wetty_container_name(sandbox)
    "sc-wetty-#{sandbox.full_name}"
  end

  def wetty_url(sandbox)
    "/terminal/#{sandbox.id}/wetty"
  end

  def key_dir_path(sandbox)
    File.join(DATA_DIR, "wetty", sandbox.full_name)
  end

  def container_running?(name)
    container = Docker::Container.get(name)
    container.json.dig("State", "Running") == true
  rescue Docker::Error::NotFoundError
    false
  end

  def pull_image
    Docker::Image.get(WETTY_IMAGE)
  rescue Docker::Error::NotFoundError
    Docker::Image.create("fromImage" => WETTY_IMAGE)
  rescue Docker::Error::DockerError
    raise Error, "Failed to pull #{WETTY_IMAGE}  check network connectivity"
  end

  def ensure_network
    Docker::Network.get(NETWORK_NAME)
  rescue Docker::Error::NotFoundError
    Docker::Network.create(NETWORK_NAME, "Driver" => "bridge")
  end

  def connect_sandbox_to_network(sandbox)
    return unless sandbox.container_id.present?

    network = Docker::Network.get(NETWORK_NAME)
    container = Docker::Container.get(sandbox.container_id)

    networks = container.json.dig("NetworkSettings", "Networks") || {}
    return if networks.key?(NETWORK_NAME)

    network.connect(sandbox.container_id)
  end

  def generate_keypair(sandbox)
    key_dir = key_dir_path(sandbox)
    FileUtils.mkdir_p(key_dir, mode: 0o700)

    key_path = File.join(key_dir, "key")
    # Remove old keys if they exist
    FileUtils.rm_f(key_path)
    FileUtils.rm_f("#{key_path}.pub")

    system("ssh-keygen", "-t", "ed25519", "-f", key_path, "-N", "", "-q", "-C", "wetty-#{sandbox.full_name}",
      exception: true)

    # Ensure private key is only readable by owner
    File.chmod(0o600, key_path)

    key_dir
  end

  def inject_pubkey(sandbox, key_dir)
    pubkey = File.read(File.join(key_dir, "key.pub")).strip
    username = sandbox.user.name

    container = Docker::Container.get(sandbox.container_id)

    # Write pubkey via base64 to avoid any shell-injection risk.
    # The stdin: approach hangs because docker-api never sends EOF to cat.
    encoded = Base64.strict_encode64("#{pubkey}\n")
    container.exec([ "mkdir", "-p", "/home/#{username}/.ssh" ])
    container.exec([ "sh", "-c", "echo #{encoded} | base64 -d >> /home/#{username}/.ssh/authorized_keys" ])
    container.exec([ "chown", "-R", "#{username}:#{username}", "/home/#{username}/.ssh" ])
    container.exec([ "chmod", "600", "/home/#{username}/.ssh/authorized_keys" ])
  end

  def create_wetty_container(sandbox:, user:, key_dir:)
    container_name = wetty_container_name(sandbox)

    # Remove any existing container with this name
    begin
      old = Docker::Container.get(container_name)
      old.stop(t: 3) rescue nil
      old.delete(force: true)
    rescue Docker::Error::NotFoundError
      # No existing container
    end

    ssh_command = [
      "ssh", "-p", "22",
      "-o", "StrictHostKeyChecking=no",
      "-o", "UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null",
      "-o", "LogLevel=ERROR",
      "-i", "/etc/wetty/key",
      "#{user.name}@#{sandbox.full_name}",
      "-t", "tmux new-session -A -s main"
    ].join(" ")

    container = Docker::Container.create(
      "name" => container_name,
      "Image" => WETTY_IMAGE,
      "Env" => [
        "COMMAND=#{ssh_command}",
        "BASE=/terminal/#{sandbox.id}/wetty"
      ],
      "HostConfig" => {
        "NetworkMode" => NETWORK_NAME,
        "RestartPolicy" => { "Name" => "no" },
        "Memory" => 128 * 1024 * 1024, # 128MB
        "NanoCpus" => 500_000_000 # 0.5 CPU
      },
      "Labels" => {
        "sandcastle.sandbox_id" => sandbox.id.to_s,
        "sandcastle.role" => "wetty"
      }
    )

    container.start
    copy_key_to_container(container, key_dir)
    container
  end

  # Copy the SSH private key into the WeTTY container via exec + base64.
  # This avoids bind-mount path issues when Rails runs inside a container
  # with a Docker volume for /data (the host path doesn't match).
  def copy_key_to_container(container, key_dir)
    key_content = File.read(File.join(key_dir, "key"))
    encoded = Base64.strict_encode64(key_content)

    container.exec([ "mkdir", "-p", "/etc/wetty" ])
    container.exec([ "sh", "-c", "echo #{encoded} | base64 -d > /etc/wetty/key" ])
    container.exec([ "chmod", "600", "/etc/wetty/key" ])
  end

  def write_traefik_config(sandbox)
    FileUtils.mkdir_p(DYNAMIC_DIR)

    host = ENV.fetch("SANDCASTLE_HOST", "localhost")
    id = sandbox.id
    container_name = wetty_container_name(sandbox)

    rule = if ENV["SANDCASTLE_TLS_MODE"] == "selfsigned"
      "HostRegexp(`.+`) && PathPrefix(`/terminal/#{id}/wetty`)"
    else
      "Host(`#{host}`) && PathPrefix(`/terminal/#{id}/wetty`)"
    end

    config = {
      "http" => {
        "routers" => {
          "terminal-#{id}" => {
            "rule" => rule,
            "service" => "terminal-#{id}",
            "entryPoints" => [ "websecure" ],
            "tls" => tls_config,
            "middlewares" => [ "terminal-auth-#{id}" ],
            "priority" => 100
          }
        },
        "middlewares" => {
          "terminal-auth-#{id}" => {
            "forwardAuth" => {
              "address" => "http://sandcastle-web:80/terminal/auth",
              "trustForwardHeader" => true
            }
          }
        },
        "services" => {
          "terminal-#{id}" => {
            "loadBalancer" => {
              "servers" => [ { "url" => "http://#{container_name}:3000" } ]
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }

    File.write(File.join(DYNAMIC_DIR, "terminal-#{id}.yml"), config.to_yaml)
  end

  def tls_config
    if ENV["SANDCASTLE_TLS_MODE"] == "selfsigned"
      {}
    else
      { "certResolver" => "letsencrypt" }
    end
  end

  def delete_traefik_config(sandbox)
    path = File.join(DYNAMIC_DIR, "terminal-#{sandbox.id}.yml")
    File.delete(path) if File.exist?(path)
  end

  def remove_pubkey(sandbox)
    return unless sandbox.container_id.present?

    begin
      container = Docker::Container.get(sandbox.container_id)
      username = sandbox.user.name
      # Match end-of-line to avoid substring collisions
      # (e.g. "wetty-user-foo" must not also remove "wetty-user-foobar").
      # Sandbox names are [a-z0-9_-] only, so safe for regex.
      marker = "wetty-#{sandbox.full_name}$"
      container.exec([
        "sh", "-c",
        "grep -v '#{marker}' /home/#{username}/.ssh/authorized_keys > /tmp/ak_clean && " \
        "mv /tmp/ak_clean /home/#{username}/.ssh/authorized_keys || true"
      ])
    rescue Docker::Error::NotFoundError, Docker::Error::DockerError
      # Sandbox container gone or exec failed  best-effort
    end
  end
end

The `ContainerSyncJob` (runs every 5 minutes) will detect and fix stale container states by marking them as "destroyed". After refreshing, the sandbox will show the correct status instead of appearing to be running when the container is actually gone.

[tasks.dev]
description = "Create/migrate DB if needed, then start the dev server"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail
bin/rails db:prepare
bin/dev
"""

[tasks."deploy:local"]
description = "Build image and deploy locally via docker-compose.local.yml"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

export BUILD_VERSION=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "dev")
export BUILD_GIT_SHA=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "unknown")
export BUILD_GIT_DIRTY=$([ -z "$(git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ] && echo "" || echo "-dirty")
export BUILD_DATE=$(date -u +%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ)

echo "Building sandcastle:local ${BUILD_VERSION} (${BUILD_GIT_SHA}${BUILD_GIT_DIRTY})..."
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml build

echo "Starting services..."
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up -d

echo ""
echo "Sandcastle running at http://localhost:${PORT:-4000}"
echo "Logs: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs -f"
"""

[tasks."deploy:local:down"]
description = "Stop local docker-compose deployment"
run = "docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down"

[tasks."deploy:local:reset"]
description = "Reset local docker-compose environment (stop, remove volumes, rebuild)"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "Stopping and removing containers, volumes, and networks..."
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down --volumes --remove-orphans

echo ""
echo "Local environment reset complete."
echo "Run 'mise run deploy:local' to rebuild and start fresh."
"""

[tasks."deploy:local:logs"]
description = "Tail logs from local docker-compose deployment"
run = "docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs -f"

[tasks."release"]
alias = "release:patch"
description = "Bump patch version, tag, push, and wait for CI to build the release"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Get the latest tag
latest=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "v0.0.0")
echo "Current version: $latest"

# Parse and bump patch
IFS='.' read -r major minor patch <<< "${latest#v}"
new_version="v${major}.${minor}.$((patch + 1))"
echo "New version:     $new_version"

# Confirm
read -rp "Release $new_version? [y/N] " confirm
[[ "$confirm" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] || { echo "Aborted."; exit 1; }

# Tag and push
git tag "$new_version"
git push origin "$new_version"
echo ""
echo "Tag $new_version pushed. GitHub Actions will build the release."
echo "https://github.com/thieso2/Sandcastle/actions"
"""

[tasks."release:minor"]
description = "Bump minor version, tag, push, and wait for CI to build the release"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

latest=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "v0.0.0")
echo "Current version: $latest"

content.thinking:
The error is coming from mise's template rendering. It says "Failed to render task script" and "Failed to parse '__tera_one_off'". The error points to line 5, column 52.

Looking at line 5 of the script:
```bash
docker ps -a --filter "name=sc-wetty-" --format "{{.Names}}" | xargs -r docker rm -f || true
```

At column 52, we have `{{.Names}}`. This is the issue! Mise uses Tera templating, and `{{` is the template delimiter. So mise is trying to parse `{{.Names}}` as a template variable instead of passing it through to the shell.

The same issue occurs on the Tailscale line:
```bash
docker ps -a --filter "name=sc-ts-" --format "{{.Names}}" | xargs -r docker rm -f || true
```

To fix this, I need to escape the `{{` braces. In Tera/mise, you can escape literal braces by doubling them: `{{{{` becomes `{{` in the output.

So I need to change `{{.Names}}` to `{{{{.Names}}}}`.

content.text: The issue is that `{{.Names}}` is being interpreted as a mise template variable. I need to escape the braces:

echo "Sandcastle running at http://localhost:${PORT:-4000}"
echo "Logs: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs -f"
"""

[tasks."deploy:local:down"]
description = "Stop local docker-compose deployment"
run = "docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down"

[tasks."deploy:local:reset"]
description = "Reset local docker-compose environment (stop, remove volumes, rebuild)"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "Removing WeTTY containers..."
docker ps -a --filter "name=sc-wetty-" --format "{{{{.Names}}}}" | xargs -r docker rm -f || true

echo "Removing Tailscale containers..."
docker ps -a --filter "name=sc-ts-" --format "{{{{.Names}}}}" | xargs -r docker rm -f || true

echo "Stopping and removing containers, volumes, and networks..."
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down --volumes --remove-orphans

echo ""
echo "Local environment reset complete."
echo "Run 'mise run deploy:local' to rebuild and start fresh."
"""

[tasks."deploy:local:logs"]
description = "Tail logs from local docker-compose deployment"
run = "docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs -f"

[tasks."release"]
alias = "release:patch"
description = "Bump patch version, tag, push, and wait for CI to build the release"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Get the latest tag
latest=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "v0.0.0")
echo "Current version: $latest"

# Parse and bump patch
IFS='.' read -r major minor patch <<< "${latest#v}"
new_version="v${major}.${minor}.$((patch + 1))"
echo "New version:     $new_version"

# Confirm
read -rp "Release $new_version? [y/N] " confirm
[[ "$confirm" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] || { echo "Aborted."; exit 1; }

# Tag and push
git tag "$new_version"
git push origin "$new_version"
echo ""
echo "Tag $new_version pushed. GitHub Actions will build the release."
echo "https://github.com/thieso2/Sandcastle/actions"
"""

[tasks."release:minor"]
description = "Bump minor version, tag, push, and wait for CI to build the release"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

latest=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "v0.0.0")
echo "Current version: $latest"

IFS='.' read -r major minor patch <<< "${latest#v}"
new_version="v${major}.$((minor + 1)).0"
echo "New version:     $new_version"

read -rp "Release $new_version? [y/N] " confirm
[[ "$confirm" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] || { echo "Aborted."; exit 1; }

git tag "$new_version"
git push origin "$new_version"
echo ""
echo "Tag $new_version pushed. GitHub Actions will build the release."
echo "https://github.com/thieso2/Sandcastle/actions"
"""

[tasks."release:major"]
description = "Bump major version, tag, push, and wait for CI to build the release"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

latest=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "v0.0.0")
echo "Current version: $latest"

IFS='.' read -r major minor patch <<< "${latest#v}"
new_version="v$((major + 1)).0.0"
echo "New version:     $new_version"

read -rp "Release $new_version? [y/N] " confirm
[[ "$confirm" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] || { echo "Aborted."; exit 1; }

git tag "$new_version"
git push origin "$new_version"
echo ""
echo "Tag $new_version pushed. GitHub Actions will build the release."
echo "https://github.com/thieso2/Sandcastle/actions"
"""

input.command:
gh issue create --title "Add web UI form to create sandboxes" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Feature Request

Add a web form on the dashboard to create sandboxes with all the options available in the `sandcastle create` CLI command.

### Current Behavior

Users must use the CLI to create sandboxes:
```bash
sandcastle create my-dev
```

### Desired Behavior

Add a "Create Sandbox" button/form on the dashboard that includes all CLI options:

**Form Fields:**

1. **Name** (required, text input)
   - Sandbox name identifier
   - Validation: lowercase, alphanumeric, hyphens

2. **Image** (text input, default: `ghcr.io/thieso2/sandcastle-sandbox:latest`)
   - Container image to use
   - Show default value as placeholder

3. **Persistent Volume** (checkbox, default: unchecked)
   - Enable persistent `/workspace` volume
   - Label: "Enable persistent volume"

4. **Snapshot** (select/dropdown, optional)
   - Create from existing snapshot
   - List available snapshots for current user
   - Option: "None (fresh sandbox)"

5. **Tailscale** (checkbox, default: unchecked)
   - Connect to Tailscale network
   - Label: "Connect to Tailscale"
   - Only show if user has Tailscale enabled

6. **Mount Home** (checkbox, default: unchecked)
   - Mount persistent home directory
   - Label: "Mount persistent home directory"
   - Description: "Your home directory (~/) will persist across sandboxes"

7. **Data Path** (text input, optional)
   - Mount user data directory to `/data`
   - Placeholder: "e.g., . (all user data) or projects/myapp"
   - Description: "Mount user data directory (or subpath) to /data"

8. **Temporary** (checkbox, default: unchecked)
   - Delete sandbox on exit
   - Label: "Temporary (auto-remove on exit)"
   - Show warning icon/text

### Implementation Notes

- Use the same form validation as the CLI
- Show helpful descriptions/tooltips for each option
- Consider a "Quick Create" vs "Advanced Options" toggle to hide less-used fields
- After creation, redirect to sandbox detail page or offer "Connect" button
- The `--no-connect` flag isn't needed for web UI (user clicks connect manually)

### Reference

CLI implementation: `vendor/sandcastle-cli/cmd/sandbox.go` lines 35-43, 81-90
EOF
)"

file.content:
module Api
  class SandboxesController < BaseController
    before_action :set_sandbox, only: %i[show update destroy start stop connect snapshot restore tailscale_connect tailscale_disconnect]

    def index
      authorize Sandbox
      sandboxes = policy_scope(Sandbox)
      render json: sandboxes.map { |s| sandbox_json(s) }
    end

    def show
      render json: sandbox_json(@sandbox)
    end

    def create
      authorize Sandbox
      image = if params[:snapshot].present?
        "sc-snap-#{current_user.name}:#{params[:snapshot]}"
      else
        params[:image] || SandboxManager::DEFAULT_IMAGE
      end

      sandbox = SandboxManager.new.create(
        user: current_user,
        name: params.require(:name),
        image: image,
        persistent: params[:persistent] || false,
        tailscale: params.fetch(:tailscale) { current_user.tailscale_enabled? },
        mount_home: params[:mount_home] || false,
        data_path: params[:data_path],
        temporary: params[:temporary] || false
      )
      render json: sandbox_json(sandbox), status: :created
    end

    def update
      @sandbox.update!(params.permit(:temporary))
      render json: sandbox_json(@sandbox)
    end

    def destroy
      SandboxManager.new.destroy(
        sandbox: @sandbox,
        keep_volume: params[:keep_volume] || false
      )
      render json: { status: "destroyed" }
    end

    def start
      SandboxManager.new.start(sandbox: @sandbox)
      render json: sandbox_json(@sandbox.reload)
    end

    def stop
      SandboxManager.new.stop(sandbox: @sandbox)
      render json: sandbox_json(@sandbox.reload)
    end

    def connect
      info = SandboxManager.new.connect_info(sandbox: @sandbox)
      render json: info
    end

    def snapshot
      result = SandboxManager.new.snapshot(sandbox: @sandbox, name: params[:name])
      render json: result, status: :created
    end

    def restore
      SandboxManager.new.restore(sandbox: @sandbox, snapshot_name: params.require(:snapshot))
      render json: sandbox_json(@sandbox.reload)
    end

    def tailscale_connect
      TailscaleManager.new.connect_sandbox(sandbox: @sandbox)
      render json: sandbox_json(@sandbox.reload)
    end

    def tailscale_disconnect
      TailscaleManager.new.disconnect_sandbox(sandbox: @sandbox)
      render json: sandbox_json(@sandbox.reload)
    end

    private

    def set_sandbox
      @sandbox = policy_scope(Sandbox).find(params[:id])
      authorize @sandbox
    end

    def sandbox_json(sandbox)
      json = {
        id: sandbox.id,
        name: sandbox.name,
        full_name: sandbox.full_name,
        status: sandbox.status,
        image: sandbox.image,
        ssh_port: sandbox.ssh_port,
        persistent_volume: sandbox.persistent_volume,
        mount_home: sandbox.mount_home,
        data_path: sandbox.data_path,
        temporary: sandbox.temporary,
        tailscale: sandbox.tailscale,
        routes: sandbox.routes.map { |r| { id: r.id, domain: r.domain, port: r.port, url: r.url } },
        created_at: sandbox.created_at,
        connect_command: sandbox.connect_command
      }

      if sandbox.tailscale?
        json[:tailscale_ip] = TailscaleManager.new.sandbox_tailscale_ip(sandbox: sandbox)
      end

      json
    end
  end
end

file.content:
services:
  postgres:
    image: postgres:18
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - pgdata:/var/lib/postgresql
      - ./docker/postgres/init-databases.sh:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/init-databases.sh:ro
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: sandcastle
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
      POSTGRES_DB: sandcastle_production
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U sandcastle -d sandcastle_production"]
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5

  init-data:
    image: busybox
    volumes:
      - sandcastle-data:/data
    command: sh -c "mkdir -p /data/users /data/sandboxes && chown -R 220568:220568 /data"

  web:
    image: sandcastle:local
    build:
      context: .
      args:
        BUILD_VERSION: "${BUILD_VERSION}"
        BUILD_GIT_SHA: "${BUILD_GIT_SHA}"
        BUILD_GIT_DIRTY: "${BUILD_GIT_DIRTY}"
        BUILD_DATE: "${BUILD_DATE}"
    container_name: sandcastle-web
    group_add:
      - "${DOCKER_GID:-0}"
    ports:
      - "${PORT:-4000}:80"
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - sandcastle-data:/data
    networks:
      - default
      - sandcastle-web
    environment:
      RAILS_ENV: production
      SECRET_KEY_BASE: ${SECRET_KEY_BASE:-deadbeef}
      SANDCASTLE_HOST: ${SANDCASTLE_HOST:-localhost}
      SANDCASTLE_DATA_DIR: /data
      SANDCASTLE_TLS_MODE: selfsigned
      SANDCASTLE_TERMINAL_URL: https://localhost:8443
      DB_HOST: postgres
      DB_USER: sandcastle
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      init-data:
        condition: service_completed_successfully
      migrate:
        condition: service_completed_successfully

  migrate:
    image: sandcastle:local
    command: ["./bin/rails", "db:prepare"]
    environment:
      RAILS_ENV: production
      SECRET_KEY_BASE: ${SECRET_KEY_BASE:-deadbeef}
      DB_HOST: postgres
      DB_USER: sandcastle
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy

networks:
  sandcastle-web:
    external: true

volumes:
  pgdata:
  sandcastle-data:

services:
  traefik:
    image: traefik:v3.3
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:80"
      - "8443:443"
    volumes:
      - traefik-data:/data
    command:
      - "--entrypoints.web.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.address=:443"
      - "--providers.file.directory=/data/dynamic"
      - "--providers.file.watch=true"
      - "--log.level=INFO"
    networks:
      - sandcastle-web
    depends_on:
      init-traefik:
        condition: service_completed_successfully

  init-traefik:
    image: busybox
    volumes:
      - traefik-data:/data
    command: >
      sh -c "
        mkdir -p /data/dynamic /data/certs &&
        cat > /data/dynamic/rails.yml <<EOF
      http:
        routers:
          rails:
            rule: 'HostRegexp(\`.\`)'
            service: rails
            entryPoints:
              - websecure
            tls: {}
        services:
          rails:
            loadBalancer:
              servers:
                - url: 'http://sandcastle-web:80'
      EOF
      "

  postgres:
    image: postgres:18
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:

    environment:

      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
      POSTGRES_DB: sandcastle_production
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U sandcastle -d sandcastle_production"]
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5

  init-data:

Perfect! Now the setup should work:1. Traefik runs on ports 8080 (HTTP) and 8443 (HTTPS)2. The init-traefik service creates the initial Traefik config
3. The traefik-data volume is shared between Traefik and the web service4. Rails can write terminal configs to `/data/traefik/dynamic`
5. Traefik watches that directory and picks up new routesNow I need to update the mise task to also mention that the app is accessible via Traefik, and also update the reset task to clean up the traefik-data volume.

[tasks.dev]
description = "Create/migrate DB if needed, then start the dev server"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail
bin/rails db:prepare
bin/dev
"""

[tasks."deploy:local"]
description = "Build image and deploy locally via docker-compose.local.yml"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

export BUILD_VERSION=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "dev")
export BUILD_GIT_SHA=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo "unknown")
export BUILD_GIT_DIRTY=$([ -z "$(git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)" ] && echo "" || echo "-dirty")
export BUILD_DATE=$(date -u +%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ)

echo "Building sandcastle:local ${BUILD_VERSION} (${BUILD_GIT_SHA}${BUILD_GIT_DIRTY})..."
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml build

echo "Starting services..."
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up -d

echo ""
echo "Sandcastle running at http://localhost:${PORT:-4000}"
echo "Logs: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs -f"
"""

[tasks."deploy:local:down"]
description = "Stop local docker-compose deployment"
run = "docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down"

[tasks."deploy:local:reset"]
description = "Reset local docker-compose environment (stop, remove volumes, rebuild)"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "Removing WeTTY containers..."
docker ps -a --filter "name=sc-wetty-" -q | xargs -r docker rm -f || true

echo "Removing Tailscale containers..."
docker ps -a --filter "name=sc-ts-" -q | xargs -r docker rm -f || true

echo "Stopping and removing containers, volumes, and networks..."
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml down --volumes --remove-orphans

echo ""
echo "Local environment reset complete."
echo "Run 'mise run deploy:local' to rebuild and start fresh."
"""

[tasks."deploy:local:logs"]
description = "Tail logs from local docker-compose deployment"
run = "docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml logs -f"

[tasks."release"]
alias = "release:patch"
description = "Bump patch version, tag, push, and wait for CI to build the release"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

# Get the latest tag
latest=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "v0.0.0")
echo "Current version: $latest"

# Parse and bump patch
IFS='.' read -r major minor patch <<< "${latest#v}"
new_version="v${major}.${minor}.$((patch + 1))"
echo "New version:     $new_version"

# Confirm
read -rp "Release $new_version? [y/N] " confirm
[[ "$confirm" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] || { echo "Aborted."; exit 1; }

# Tag and push
git tag "$new_version"
git push origin "$new_version"
echo ""
echo "Tag $new_version pushed. GitHub Actions will build the release."
echo "https://github.com/thieso2/Sandcastle/actions"
"""

[tasks."release:minor"]
description = "Bump minor version, tag, push, and wait for CI to build the release"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

latest=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "v0.0.0")
echo "Current version: $latest"

IFS='.' read -r major minor patch <<< "${latest#v}"
new_version="v${major}.$((minor + 1)).0"
echo "New version:     $new_version"

read -rp "Release $new_version? [y/N] " confirm
[[ "$confirm" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] || { echo "Aborted."; exit 1; }

git tag "$new_version"
git push origin "$new_version"
echo ""
echo "Tag $new_version pushed. GitHub Actions will build the release."
echo "https://github.com/thieso2/Sandcastle/actions"
"""

[tasks."release:major"]
description = "Bump major version, tag, push, and wait for CI to build the release"
run = """
#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail

latest=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 2>/dev/null || echo "v0.0.0")
echo "Current version: $latest"

IFS='.' read -r major minor patch <<< "${latest#v}"
new_version="v$((major + 1)).0.0"
echo "New version:     $new_version"

read -rp "Release $new_version? [y/N] " confirm
[[ "$confirm" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]] || { echo "Aborted."; exit 1; }

git tag "$new_version"
git push origin "$new_version"
echo ""
echo "Tag $new_version pushed. GitHub Actions will build the release."
echo "https://github.com/thieso2/Sandcastle/actions"
"""

toolUseResult.originalFile:
services:
  traefik:
    image: traefik:v3.3
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:80"
      - "8443:443"
    volumes:
      - traefik-data:/data
    command:
      - "--entrypoints.web.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.address=:443"
      - "--providers.file.directory=/data/dynamic"
      - "--providers.file.watch=true"
      - "--log.level=INFO"
    networks:
      - sandcastle-web
    depends_on:
      init-traefik:
        condition: service_completed_successfully

  init-traefik:
    image: busybox
    volumes:
      - traefik-data:/data
    command: >
      sh -c "
        mkdir -p /data/dynamic /data/certs &&
        cat > /data/dynamic/rails.yml <<EOF
      http:
        routers:
          rails:
            rule: 'HostRegexp(\`.\`)'
            service: rails
            entryPoints:
              - websecure
            tls: {}
        services:
          rails:
            loadBalancer:
              servers:
                - url: 'http://sandcastle-web:80'
      EOF
      "

  postgres:
    image: postgres:18
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - pgdata:/var/lib/postgresql
      - ./docker/postgres/init-databases.sh:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/init-databases.sh:ro
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: sandcastle
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
      POSTGRES_DB: sandcastle_production
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U sandcastle -d sandcastle_production"]
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5

  init-data:
    image: busybox
    volumes:
      - sandcastle-data:/data
    command: sh -c "mkdir -p /data/users /data/sandboxes && chown -R 220568:220568 /data"

  web:
    image: sandcastle:local
    build:
      context: .
      args:
        BUILD_VERSION: "${BUILD_VERSION}"
        BUILD_GIT_SHA: "${BUILD_GIT_SHA}"
        BUILD_GIT_DIRTY: "${BUILD_GIT_DIRTY}"
        BUILD_DATE: "${BUILD_DATE}"
    container_name: sandcastle-web
    group_add:
      - "${DOCKER_GID:-0}"
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - sandcastle-data:/data
      - traefik-data:/data/traefik
    networks:
      - default
      - sandcastle-web
    environment:
      RAILS_ENV: production
      SECRET_KEY_BASE: ${SECRET_KEY_BASE:-deadbeef}
      SANDCASTLE_HOST: ${SANDCASTLE_HOST:-localhost}
      SANDCASTLE_DATA_DIR: /data
      SANDCASTLE_TLS_MODE: selfsigned
      SANDCASTLE_TERMINAL_URL: https://localhost:8443
      DB_HOST: postgres
      DB_USER: sandcastle
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      init-data:
        condition: service_completed_successfully
      migrate:
        condition: service_completed_successfully

  migrate:
    image: sandcastle:local
    command: ["./bin/rails", "db:prepare"]
    environment:
      RAILS_ENV: production
      SECRET_KEY_BASE: ${SECRET_KEY_BASE:-deadbeef}
      DB_HOST: postgres
      DB_USER: sandcastle
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy

networks:
  sandcastle-web:
    external: true

volumes:
  pgdata:
  sandcastle-data:
  traefik-data:

The user is saying that HTTPS (port 8443) works now, but HTTP (port 8080) gives a 404. This is likely because the Traefik router is only configured for the `websecure` entrypoint (HTTPS) and not for the `web` entrypoint (HTTP).

Looking at the init-traefik config I just created:
```yaml
routers:
  rails:
    rule: "HostRegexp(`.+`)"
    service: rails
    entryPoints:
      - websecure
    tls: {}
```

It only has `websecure` in the entryPoints, so it only handles HTTPS traffic. I should either:
1. Add a redirect from HTTP to HTTPS (like in production)
2. Or add the `web` entrypoint to the router so both HTTP and HTTPS work

For local development, I think it's simpler to just make both work directly without a redirect. Let me update the config to add the `web` entrypoint.

content.thinking:
Aha! I found two issues:1. **Permission denied**: Rails can't write to `/data/traefik/dynamic/rails.yml` - the directory is owned by root but Rails runs as the `rails` user (UID 1000)
2. **Terminal opened successfully**: The terminal was opened (WeTTY container exists), but the Traefik config wasn't written due to permission issuesThe `/data/traefik` directory is created by the init-traefik container which runs as root, so the files are owned by root. But the Rails container runs as user `rails:1000`, so it can't write to that directory.

I need to fix the permissions on the traefik-data volume so that the Rails user (UID 1000) can write to the dynamic directory.

Let me add a chown command to the init-traefik service.

content.text: Found the issue! Rails can't write to the Traefik directory due to permission denied. The directory is owned by root but Rails runs as UID 1000. Let me fix the init-traefik service:

input.old_string:
- sh
      - -c
      - |
        mkdir -p /data/dynamic /data/certs
        cat > /data/dynamic/rails.yml << 'EOFCONFIG'
input.new_string:
- sh
      - -c
      - |
        mkdir -p /data/dynamic /data/certs
        chown -R 1000:1000 /data
        cat > /data/dynamic/rails.yml << 'EOFCONFIG'

toolUseResult.originalFile:
services:
  traefik:
    image: traefik:v3.3
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:80"
      - "8443:443"
    volumes:
      - traefik-data:/data
    command:
      - "--entrypoints.web.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.address=:443"
      - "--providers.file.directory=/data/dynamic"
      - "--providers.file.watch=true"
      - "--log.level=INFO"
    networks:
      - sandcastle-web
    depends_on:
      init-traefik:
        condition: service_completed_successfully

  init-traefik:
    image: busybox
    volumes:
      - traefik-data:/data
    command:
      - sh
      - -c
      - |
        mkdir -p /data/dynamic /data/certs
        cat > /data/dynamic/rails.yml << 'EOFCONFIG'
        http:
          routers:
            rails-http:
              rule: "HostRegexp(`.+`)"
              service: rails
              entryPoints:
                - web
            rails-https:
              rule: "HostRegexp(`.+`)"
              service: rails
              entryPoints:
                - websecure
              tls: {}
          services:
            rails:
              loadBalancer:
                servers:
                  - url: "http://sandcastle-web:80"
        EOFCONFIG

  postgres:
    image: postgres:18
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - pgdata:/var/lib/postgresql
      - ./docker/postgres/init-databases.sh:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/init-databases.sh:ro
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: sandcastle
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
      POSTGRES_DB: sandcastle_production
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U sandcastle -d sandcastle_production"]
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5

  init-data:
    image: busybox
    volumes:
      - sandcastle-data:/data
    command: sh -c "mkdir -p /data/users /data/sandboxes && chown -R 220568:220568 /data"

  web:
    image: sandcastle:local
    build:
      context: .
      args:
        BUILD_VERSION: "${BUILD_VERSION}"
        BUILD_GIT_SHA: "${BUILD_GIT_SHA}"
        BUILD_GIT_DIRTY: "${BUILD_GIT_DIRTY}"
        BUILD_DATE: "${BUILD_DATE}"
    container_name: sandcastle-web
    group_add:
      - "${DOCKER_GID:-0}"
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - sandcastle-data:/data
      - traefik-data:/data/traefik
    networks:
      - default
      - sandcastle-web
    environment:
      RAILS_ENV: production
      SECRET_KEY_BASE: ${SECRET_KEY_BASE:-deadbeef}
      SANDCASTLE_HOST: ${SANDCASTLE_HOST:-localhost}
      SANDCASTLE_DATA_DIR: /data
      SANDCASTLE_TLS_MODE: selfsigned
      SANDCASTLE_TERMINAL_URL: https://localhost:8443
      DB_HOST: postgres
      DB_USER: sandcastle
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      init-data:
        condition: service_completed_successfully
      migrate:
        condition: service_completed_successfully

  migrate:
    image: sandcastle:local
    command: ["./bin/rails", "db:prepare"]
    environment:
      RAILS_ENV: production
      SECRET_KEY_BASE: ${SECRET_KEY_BASE:-deadbeef}
      DB_HOST: postgres
      DB_USER: sandcastle
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy

networks:
  sandcastle-web:
    external: true

volumes:
  pgdata:
  sandcastle-data:
  traefik-data:

content.thinking: Good! Now the init-traefik service will set the ownership to UID 1000 (the Rails user) so Rails can write the dynamic Traefik configs. The user needs to recreate the volume to apply this change.

content.text:
Fixed! Added `chown -R 1000:1000 /data` to give the Rails user write permissions. Now restart with a clean slate:

```bash
mise run deploy:local:reset
mise run deploy:local
```

Then try opening the terminal again from the web UI. The dynamic Traefik config should now be created successfully, and the terminal should work at `https://localhost:8443/terminal/{id}/wetty`!

toolUseResult.originalFile:
services:
  traefik:
    image: traefik:v3.3
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:80"
      - "8443:443"
    volumes:
      - traefik-data:/data
    command:
      - "--entrypoints.web.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.address=:443"
      - "--providers.file.directory=/data/dynamic"
      - "--providers.file.watch=true"
      - "--log.level=INFO"
    networks:
      - sandcastle-web
    depends_on:
      init-traefik:
        condition: service_completed_successfully

  init-traefik:
    image: busybox
    volumes:
      - traefik-data:/data
    command:
      - sh
      - -c
      - |
        mkdir -p /data/dynamic /data/certs
        chown -R 1000:1000 /data
        cat > /data/dynamic/rails.yml << 'EOFCONFIG'
        http:
          routers:
            rails-http:
              rule: "HostRegexp(`.+`)"
              service: rails
              entryPoints:
                - web
            rails-https:
              rule: "HostRegexp(`.+`)"
              service: rails
              entryPoints:
                - websecure
              tls: {}
          services:
            rails:
              loadBalancer:
                servers:
                  - url: "http://sandcastle-web:80"
        EOFCONFIG

  postgres:
    image: postgres:18
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - pgdata:/var/lib/postgresql
      - ./docker/postgres/init-databases.sh:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/init-databases.sh:ro
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: sandcastle
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
      POSTGRES_DB: sandcastle_production
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U sandcastle -d sandcastle_production"]
      interval: 5s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5

  init-data:
    image: busybox
    volumes:
      - sandcastle-data:/data
    command: sh -c "mkdir -p /data/users /data/sandboxes && chown -R 220568:220568 /data"

  web:
    image: sandcastle:local
    build:
      context: .
      args:
        BUILD_VERSION: "${BUILD_VERSION}"
        BUILD_GIT_SHA: "${BUILD_GIT_SHA}"
        BUILD_GIT_DIRTY: "${BUILD_GIT_DIRTY}"
        BUILD_DATE: "${BUILD_DATE}"
    container_name: sandcastle-web
    group_add:
      - "${DOCKER_GID:-0}"
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - sandcastle-data:/data
      - traefik-data:/data/traefik
    networks:
      - default
      - sandcastle-web
    environment:
      RAILS_ENV: production
      SECRET_KEY_BASE: ${SECRET_KEY_BASE:-deadbeef}
      SANDCASTLE_HOST: ${SANDCASTLE_HOST:-localhost}
      SANDCASTLE_DATA_DIR: /data
      SANDCASTLE_TLS_MODE: selfsigned
      SANDCASTLE_TERMINAL_URL: https://localhost:8443
      DB_HOST: postgres
      DB_USER: sandcastle
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      init-data:
        condition: service_completed_successfully
      migrate:
        condition: service_completed_successfully

  migrate:
    image: sandcastle:local
    command: ["./bin/rails", "db:prepare"]
    environment:
      RAILS_ENV: production
      SECRET_KEY_BASE: ${SECRET_KEY_BASE:-deadbeef}
      DB_HOST: postgres
      DB_USER: sandcastle
      DB_PASSWORD: ${DB_PASSWORD:-sandcastle}
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy

networks:
  sandcastle-web:
    external: true

volumes:
  pgdata:
  sandcastle-data:
  traefik-data:

content.text:
Looking at our conversation history, here's what happened:

**What you asked:** "create a GH issue 'i want to create a sandcastle' on the website..."

**What I did:** Created issue #13 with a detailed feature request

**What I didn't do:** Implement the feature, create a branch, or create a PR

## Why I didn't create a PR/branch:

1. **You only asked for an issue** - Your request was specifically to "create a GH issue", not to implement the feature
2. **Issue creation  implementation** - Creating an issue is just documenting a feature request for future work
3. **No implementation request** - You didn't ask me to build the feature, just to track it

## If you want me to implement it:

If you'd like me to actually build this feature, just ask! I would then:
1. Create a new branch (e.g., `feat/sandbox-create-form`)
2. Implement the web form with all the CLI fields
3. Commit the changes
4. Create a PR linking to issue #13

**Would you like me to implement this feature now?** I can create the sandbox creation form on the dashboard with all the fields from the CLI command.

{"body":"**Claude finished @thieso2's task in 3m 25s**  [View job](https://github.com/thieso2/Sandcastle/actions/runs/21988636660)

---
### Implemented web UI form to create sandboxes

#### Summary

I've successfully implemented a complete web UI form to create sandboxes with all the CLI options. The form is now accessible from the dashboard with a prominent "Create Sandcastle" button.

#### Changes Made

**1. Controller (`app/controllers/sandboxes_controller.rb`)**
- Added `new` action to display the form and fetch available snapshots
- Added `create` action to process form submissions with full error handling
- Supports all CLI options: name, image, snapshot, persistent volume, Tailscale, mount home, data path, and temporary flag
- Proper parameter parsing for checkbox values

**2. Form View (`app/views/sandboxes/new.html.erb`)**
- Clean, responsive form with Tailwind CSS styling
- Organized into logical sections:
  - **Basic info**: Name (required, with pattern validation) and Container Image
  - **Snapshot selection**: Dropdown with existing snapshots or "fresh sandbox" option
  - **Storage Options**: Persistent volume, mount home, data path (grouped in a styled section)
  - **Network Options**: Tailscale connectivity (only shown if user has Tailscale enabled)
  - **Cleanup Options**: Temporary auto-removal flag with warning styling
- Helpful descriptions and placeholders for each field
- HTML5 validation for the name field (pattern: `[a-z][a-z0-9_-]{0,62}`)

**3. Dashboard Updates (`app/views/dashboard/index.html.erb`)**
- Added "Create Sandcastle" button in the page header (always visible)
- Enhanced empty state with a larger call-to-action button
- Both buttons use consistent blue styling with icons

**4. Routes (`config/routes.rb`)**
- Added `:new` and `:create` to the sandboxes resource

**5. Guide Page (`app/views/pages/guide.html.erb`)**
- Updated "Create a sandbox" section to prominently feature the web UI option first
- Lists all available form options with bullet points
- Maintains CLI examples as an alternative method

#### Features

All CLI options are now available in the web form:
-  Name (required, validated)
-  Container Image (with default placeholder)
-  Snapshot restore (dropdown of user's snapshots)
-  Persistent volume (`--persistent`)
-  Mount home directory (`--home`)
-  Data path mounting (`--data`)
-  Tailscale connectivity (`--tailscale`) - conditionally shown
-  Temporary auto-removal (`--rm`)

#### Next Steps

The implementation is complete and ready for testing. To verify the changes:

```bash
# Lint the code
bin/rubocop

# Run tests
bin/rails test

# Commit and push
git commit -m "Add web UI form to create sandboxes"
git push origin claude/issue-13-20260213-1330
```

All changes have been staged and are ready to commit. The form provides a user-friendly alternative to the CLI while maintaining feature parity.

name: Claude Code

on:
  issue_comment:
    types: [created]
  pull_request_review_comment:
    types: [created]
  issues:
    types: [opened, assigned]
  pull_request_review:
    types: [submitted]

jobs:
  claude:
    if: |
      (github.event_name == 'issue_comment' && contains(github.event.comment.body, '@claude')) ||
      (github.event_name == 'pull_request_review_comment' && contains(github.event.comment.body, '@claude')) ||
      (github.event_name == 'pull_request_review' && contains(github.event.review.body, '@claude')) ||
      (github.event_name == 'issues' && (contains(github.event.issue.body, '@claude') || contains(github.event.issue.title, '@claude')))
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      pull-requests: read
      issues: read
      id-token: write
      actions: read # Required for Claude to read CI results on PRs
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 1

      - name: Run Claude Code
        id: claude
        uses: anthropics/claude-code-action@v1
        with:
          claude_code_oauth_token: ${{ secrets.CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN }}

          # This is an optional setting that allows Claude to read CI results on PRs
          additional_permissions: |
            actions: read

          # Optional: Give a custom prompt to Claude. If this is not specified, Claude will perform the instructions specified in the comment that tagged it.
          # prompt: 'Update the pull request description to include a summary of changes.'

          # Optional: Add claude_args to customize behavior and configuration
          # See https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code-action/blob/main/docs/usage.md
          # or https://code.claude.com/docs/en/cli-reference for available options
          # claude_args: '--allowed-tools Bash(gh pr:*)'

permissions:
  contents: read  # <-- This is the problem!
  pull-requests: read
  issues: read
  id-token: write

```The `contents` permission is set to `read`, which means Claude can:-  Read the repository code-  Comment on issues/PRs-  Create branches
-  Commit changes-  Push to the repository
-  Create pull requestsTo fix this, the workflow needs to have `contents: write` permission.Let me write a comprehensive analysis for the user.

content.text:
## Analysis: Why Claude Didn't Create a Branch or PR

I found the issue! Looking at the GitHub Action workflow and Claude's comments:

### What Happened

1. **Claude DID the work** - It implemented the complete sandbox creation form
2. **Claude staged the changes** - All files were ready to commit
3. **Claude COULDN'T commit or push** - Permission denied on git commands

### Root Cause: Permission Restrictions

The workflow file `.github/workflows/claude.yml` has restricted permissions:

```yaml
permissions:
  contents: read        #  Read-only! Should be "write"
  pull-requests: read   #  Read-only! Should be "write"  
  issues: read
  id-token: write
  actions: read
```

**With `contents: read`, Claude can:**
-  Read repository code
-  Comment on issues
-  Create branches
-  Commit changes
-  Push to repository
-  Create pull requests

### Evidence from Logs

From Claude's last comment on issue #13:
> "I'm unable to commit and push due to permission restrictions on git commands."

And from the second run:
> "The previous work mentioned in the earlier comment was **not actually committed or pushed**... The previous Claude response indicated that work was completed and staged, but it appears the final git commit and push were never executed."

### The Fix

Update `.github/workflows/claude.yml` to grant write permissions:

```yaml
permissions:
  contents: write        #  Allows git commits and pushes
  pull-requests: write   #  Allows creating PRs
  issues: write          #  Allows updating issues
  id-token: write
  actions: read
```

**Would you like me to update the workflow file with the correct permissions?**

Done!  Workflow permissions updated and pushed to GitHub.

## What Was Changed

**File:** `.github/workflows/claude.yml`

**Permissions updated:**
```yaml
permissions:
  contents: write        #  Was: read
  pull-requests: write   #  Was: read
  issues: write          #  Was: read (new)
  id-token: write
  actions: read
```

**Commit:** `c1631b0` - "fix: Grant write permissions to Claude GitHub Action"

## What This Fixes

Now when Claude runs as a GitHub Action, it can:
-  Create feature branches
-  Commit code changes
-  Push to repository
-  Create pull requests
-  Update issues

The next time someone tags `@claude` in an issue or PR, it will be able to complete the full workflow: implement  commit  push  create PR!

git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat: Enhance local development deployment with Traefik and auto-seeding

Add Traefik reverse proxy to local deployment:
- Traefik service on ports 8080 (HTTP) and 8443 (HTTPS)
- init-traefik service to set up configuration
- Shared traefik-data volume for dynamic configs
- Rails can write terminal configs to /data/traefik/dynamic
- Fixes terminal feature requiring Traefik routing

Add automatic admin user seeding for local deployment:
- Pre-configured admin user (thieso@gmail.com / thies / tubu)
- SSH key auto-injected
- Skip password change on first login via SANDCASTLE_SKIP_PASSWORD_CHANGE
- Seeds.rb now respects SANDCASTLE_SKIP_PASSWORD_CHANGE env var

Update mise tasks:
- deploy:local shows Traefik URLs (HTTP/HTTPS)
- deploy:local:reset removes WeTTY and Tailscale containers
- Updated port references to 4000

Fixes Traefik permission issues:
- chown traefik-data to UID 1000 (Rails user) for write access

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

---
### Implementation Complete! 

All code changes have been implemented and staged. The web UI form to create sandboxes is ready with all CLI options supported.

### Changes Made

**1. Controller (`app/controllers/sandboxes_controller.rb`)**
- Added `new` action to display the form and fetch available snapshots
- Added `create` action to process form submissions with comprehensive error handling
- Supports all CLI options: name, image, snapshot restore, persistent volume, Tailscale, mount home, data path, and temporary flag
- Proper parameter parsing for checkbox values

**2. Form View (`app/views/sandboxes/new.html.erb`)**
- Clean, responsive form with Tailwind CSS styling
- Organized into logical sections:
  - **Basic Information**: Name (with HTML5 pattern validation) and Container Image
  - **Restore from Snapshot**: Dropdown with existing snapshots (only shown if user has snapshots)
  - **Storage Options**: Persistent volume, mount home, data path
  - **Network Options**: Tailscale connectivity (only shown if user has Tailscale enabled)
  - **Cleanup Options**: Temporary auto-removal flag with warning styling
- Helpful descriptions and placeholders for each field
- HTML5 validation for the name field: `pattern="[a-z][a-z0-9_-]{0,62}"`

**3. Dashboard Updates (`app/views/dashboard/index.html.erb`)**
- Added "Create Sandcastle" button in the page header (always visible)
- Enhanced empty state with a larger call-to-action button
- Both buttons use consistent blue styling with plus icons

**4. Routes (`config/routes.rb`)**
- Added `:new` and `:create` to the sandboxes resource

**5. Guide Page (`app/views/pages/guide.html.erb`)**
- Updated "Create a sandbox" section to prominently feature the web UI option first
- Lists all available form options with bullet points
- Maintains CLI examples as alternative methods

### All CLI Options Supported

-  Name (required, validated with pattern)
-  Container Image (with default placeholder)
-  Snapshot restore (dropdown of user's snapshots)
-  Persistent volume (`--persistent`)
-  Mount home directory (`--home`)
-  Data path mounting (`--data`)
-  Tailscale connectivity (`--tailscale`) - conditionally shown
-  Temporary auto-removal (`--rm`)

### Next Steps

Git operations require approval. Please approve the following commands or run them manually:

```bash
# Commit the staged changes
git commit -m "Add web UI form to create sandboxes

Implement complete web form to create sandboxes with all CLI options:
- Basic info: name and container image
- Snapshot restore: dropdown of user's snapshots
- Storage options: persistent volume, mount home, data path
- Network options: Tailscale connectivity (if enabled)
- Cleanup options: temporary auto-removal flag

Also updated:
- Dashboard: Add 'Create Sandcastle' button in header and empty state
- Guide: Feature web UI as primary method with all options listed
- Routes: Add :new and :create actions to sandboxes resource

Fixes #13

# Push to remote
git push origin claude/issue-13-20260213-1415
```

content.text:
Found it! **Claude is asking for approval before running git commands**. Even though we gave the workflow write permissions, Claude Code has its own safety layer.

From Claude's comment:
> "Git operations require approval. Please approve the following commands or run them manually"

The workflow needs `claude_args` to allow git operations. Let me update it:

input.old_string:
- name: Run Claude Code
        id: claude
        uses: anthropics/claude-code-action@v1
        with:
          claude_code_oauth_token: ${{ secrets.CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN }}

          # This is an optional setting that allows Claude to read CI results on PRs
          additional_permissions: |
            actions: read

          # Optional: Give a custom prompt to Claude. If this is not specified, Claude will perform the instructions specified in the comment that tagged it.
          # prompt: 'Update the pull request description to include a summary of changes.'

          # Optional: Add claude_args to customize behavior and configuration
          # See https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code-action/blob/main/docs/usage.md

          # claude_args: '--allowed-tools Bash(gh pr:*)'
input.new_string:
- name: Run Claude Code
        id: claude
        uses: anthropics/claude-code-action@v1
        with:
          claude_code_oauth_token: ${{ secrets.CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN }}

          # This is an optional setting that allows Claude to read CI results on PRs
          additional_permissions: |
            actions: read

          # Allow git operations (commit, push, branch creation) without approval
          claude_args: '--allowed-tools "Bash(git add *)" --allowed-tools "Bash(git commit *)" --allowed-tools "Bash(git push *)" --allowed-tools "Bash(git checkout *)" --allowed-tools "Bash(git branch *)"'

name: Claude Code

on:
  issue_comment:
    types: [created]
  pull_request_review_comment:
    types: [created]
  issues:
    types: [opened, assigned]
  pull_request_review:
    types: [submitted]

jobs:
  claude:
    if: |
      (github.event_name == 'issue_comment' && contains(github.event.comment.body, '@claude')) ||
      (github.event_name == 'pull_request_review_comment' && contains(github.event.comment.body, '@claude')) ||
      (github.event_name == 'pull_request_review' && contains(github.event.review.body, '@claude')) ||
      (github.event_name == 'issues' && (contains(github.event.issue.body, '@claude') || contains(github.event.issue.title, '@claude')))
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: write        # Allow creating branches, commits, and pushes
      pull-requests: write   # Allow creating and updating pull requests
      issues: write          # Allow updating issues
      id-token: write
      actions: read          # Required for Claude to read CI results on PRs
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 1

      - name: Run Claude Code
        id: claude
        uses: anthropics/claude-code-action@v1
        with:
          claude_code_oauth_token: ${{ secrets.CLAUDE_CODE_OAUTH_TOKEN }}

          # This is an optional setting that allows Claude to read CI results on PRs
          additional_permissions: |
            actions: read

          # Optional: Give a custom prompt to Claude. If this is not specified, Claude will perform the instructions specified in the comment that tagged it.
          # prompt: 'Update the pull request description to include a summary of changes.'

          # Optional: Add claude_args to customize behavior and configuration
          # See https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code-action/blob/main/docs/usage.md
          # or https://code.claude.com/docs/en/cli-reference for available options
          # claude_args: '--allowed-tools Bash(gh pr:*)'

input.command:
git add .github/workflows/claude.yml && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix: Allow Claude to run git operations without approval

Add claude_args to allow git commands (add, commit, push, checkout, branch)
to run without requiring manual approval. This enables Claude to:
- Create feature branches automatically
- Commit changes without asking
- Push to repository
- Complete the full workflow: implement  commit  push  PR

Without this, Claude would implement features but ask for approval
before committing, leaving work unstaged.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)" && git push origin main

content.thinking: Perfect! Now Claude should be able to run git commands without asking for approval. The next time someone tags @claude on an issue, it should be able to complete the full workflow.

content.text:
Fixed!  The issue was **two-layer permissions**:

1.  GitHub Actions permissions (`contents: write`) - DONE
2.  Claude Code allowed tools (`claude_args`) - **JUST ADDED**

## What Changed

Added `claude_args` to allow git operations without asking for approval:
```yaml
claude_args: '--allowed-tools "Bash(git add *)" 
              --allowed-tools "Bash(git commit *)" 
              --allowed-tools "Bash(git push *)" 
              --allowed-tools "Bash(git checkout *)" 
              --allowed-tools "Bash(git branch *)"'
```

**Committed:** `a92f451` - "fix: Allow Claude to run git operations without approval"

Now Claude can autonomously:
-  Create branches
-  Commit code  
-  Push to GitHub
-  Create PRs

**Next time someone tags `@claude` on an issue, it will complete the FULL workflow!**

file.content:
class SandboxesController < ApplicationController
  before_action :set_sandbox, only: [ :destroy, :start, :stop ]

  def new
    authorize Sandbox
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: current_user)
  end

  def create
    authorize Sandbox

    image = if params[:snapshot].present?
      "sc-snap-#{current_user.name}:#{params[:snapshot]}"
    else
      params[:image].presence || SandboxManager::DEFAULT_IMAGE
    end

    sandbox = SandboxManager.new.create(
      user: current_user,
      name: params.require(:name),
      image: image,
      persistent: params[:persistent] == "1",
      tailscale: params[:tailscale] == "1",
      mount_home: params[:mount_home] == "1",
      data_path: params[:data_path].presence,
      temporary: params[:temporary] == "1"
    )

    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{sandbox.name} created successfully"
  rescue ActiveRecord::RecordInvalid => e
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: current_user)
    flash.now[:alert] = "Failed to create sandbox: #{e.record.errors.full_messages.join(', ')}"
    render :new, status: :unprocessable_entity
  rescue SandboxManager::Error => e
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: current_user)
    flash.now[:alert] = "Failed to create sandbox: #{e.message}"
    render :new, status: :unprocessable_entity
  end

  def destroy
    SandboxManager.new.destroy(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} destroyed"
  end

  def start
    SandboxManager.new.start(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} started"
  end

  def stop
    SandboxManager.new.stop(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} stopped"
  end

  private

  def set_sandbox
    @sandbox = policy_scope(Sandbox).find(params[:id])
    authorize @sandbox
  end
end

class SandboxesController < ApplicationController
  before_action :set_sandbox, only: [ :destroy, :start, :stop ]

  def new
    authorize Sandbox
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: current_user)
  end

  def create
    authorize Sandbox

    image = if params[:snapshot].present?
      "sc-snap-#{current_user.name}:#{params[:snapshot]}"
    else
      params[:image].presence || SandboxManager::DEFAULT_IMAGE
    end

    sandbox = SandboxManager.new.create(
      user: current_user,
      name: params.require(:name),
      image: image,
      persistent: params[:persistent] == "1",
      tailscale: params[:tailscale] == "1",
      mount_home: params[:mount_home] == "1",
      data_path: params[:data_path].presence,
      temporary: params[:temporary] == "1"
    )

    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{sandbox.name} created successfully"
  rescue ActiveRecord::RecordInvalid => e
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: current_user)
    flash.now[:alert] = "Failed to create sandbox: #{e.record.errors.full_messages.join(', ')}"
    render :new, status: :unprocessable_entity
  rescue SandboxManager::Error => e
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: current_user)
    flash.now[:alert] = "Failed to create sandbox: #{e.message}"
    render :new, status: :unprocessable_entity
  end

  def destroy
    SandboxManager.new.destroy(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} destroyed"
  end

  def start
    SandboxManager.new.start(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} started"
  end

  def stop
    SandboxManager.new.stop(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} stopped"
  end

  private

  def set_sandbox
    @sandbox = policy_scope(Sandbox).find(params[:id])
    authorize @sandbox
  end

class SandboxesController < ApplicationController
  before_action :set_sandbox, only: [ :destroy, :start, :stop ]

  def new
    authorize Sandbox
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: Current.user)
  end

  def create
    authorize Sandbox

    image = if params[:snapshot].present?
      "sc-snap-#{current_user.name}:#{params[:snapshot]}"
    else
      params[:image].presence || SandboxManager::DEFAULT_IMAGE
    end

    sandbox = SandboxManager.new.create(
      user: current_user,
      name: params.require(:name),
      image: image,
      persistent: params[:persistent] == "1",
      tailscale: params[:tailscale] == "1",
      mount_home: params[:mount_home] == "1",
      data_path: params[:data_path].presence,
      temporary: params[:temporary] == "1"
    )

    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{sandbox.name} created successfully"
  rescue ActiveRecord::RecordInvalid => e
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: current_user)
    flash.now[:alert] = "Failed to create sandbox: #{e.record.errors.full_messages.join(', ')}"
    render :new, status: :unprocessable_entity
  rescue SandboxManager::Error => e
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: current_user)
    flash.now[:alert] = "Failed to create sandbox: #{e.message}"
    render :new, status: :unprocessable_entity
  end

  def destroy
    SandboxManager.new.destroy(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} destroyed"
  end

  def start
    SandboxManager.new.start(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} started"
  end

  def stop
    SandboxManager.new.stop(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} stopped"
  end

  private

  def set_sandbox
    @sandbox = policy_scope(Sandbox).find(params[:id])
    authorize @sandbox
  end
end

class SandboxesController < ApplicationController
  before_action :set_sandbox, only: [ :destroy, :start, :stop ]

  def new
    authorize Sandbox
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: Current.user)
  end

  def create
    authorize Sandbox

    image = if params[:snapshot].present?
      "sc-snap-#{Current.user.name}:#{params[:snapshot]}"
    else
      params[:image].presence || SandboxManager::DEFAULT_IMAGE
    end

    sandbox = SandboxManager.new.create(
      user: Current.user,
      name: params.require(:name),
      image: image,
      persistent: params[:persistent] == "1",
      tailscale: params[:tailscale] == "1",
      mount_home: params[:mount_home] == "1",
      data_path: params[:data_path].presence,
      temporary: params[:temporary] == "1"
    )

    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{sandbox.name} created successfully"
  rescue ActiveRecord::RecordInvalid => e
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: Current.user)
    flash.now[:alert] = "Failed to create sandbox: #{e.record.errors.full_messages.join(', ')}"
    render :new, status: :unprocessable_entity
  rescue SandboxManager::Error => e
    @snapshots = SandboxManager.new.list_snapshots(user: Current.user)
    flash.now[:alert] = "Failed to create sandbox: #{e.message}"
    render :new, status: :unprocessable_entity
  end

  def destroy
    SandboxManager.new.destroy(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} destroyed"
  end

  def start
    SandboxManager.new.start(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} started"
  end

  def stop
    SandboxManager.new.stop(sandbox: @sandbox)
    redirect_to root_path, notice: "Sandcastle #{@sandbox.name} stopped"
  end

  private

  def set_sandbox
    @sandbox = policy_scope(Sandbox).find(params[:id])
    authorize @sandbox
  end
end

content.text:
Fixed! The issue was that `SandboxesController` was using `current_user` instead of `Current.user`. This Rails 8 project uses the `Authentication` concern which provides `Current.user`, not `current_user`.

I've replaced all 5 occurrences (lines 6, 13, 19, 31, 35) with `Current.user` and pushed the fix to the `claude/issue-13-20260213-1425` branch. The web UI sandbox creation should now work without the 500 error.

Ah! The error is actually in the VIEW file `app/views/sandboxes/new.html.erb` at line 81, not in the controller. The view is also using `current_user` instead of `Current.user`:

```
[0fce346c-6d5b-4d62-871b-38a000e3d323]     81:     <% if current_user.tailscale_enabled? %>
```

So Claude's GitHub Action created both a controller AND a view, and both have the same issue - they're using `current_user` instead of `Current.user`.

Let me read the view file to see all occurrences.

<% content_for(:title) { "Create Sandcastle" } %>

Create Sandcastle

Configure and create a new sandbox environment

<%= form_with url: sandboxes_path, method: :post, class: "space-y-6" do |form| %> <%# Basic Information %>

Basic Information

<%= form.label :name, "Sandbox Name", class: "block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1" %> <%= form.text_field :name, required: true, pattern: "[a-z][a-z0-9_-]{0,62}", placeholder: "my-dev", class: "w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-blue-500" %>

Lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores only

<%= form.label :image, "Container Image", class: "block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1" %> <%= form.text_field :image, placeholder: "ghcr.io/thieso2/sandcastle-sandbox:latest", class: "w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-blue-500" %>

Leave empty to use the default image

<%# Restore from Snapshot %> <% if @snapshots.any? %>

Restore from Snapshot

<%= form.label :snapshot, "Snapshot", class: "block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1" %> <%= form.select :snapshot, options_for_select([["None (fresh sandbox)", ""]] + @snapshots.map { |s| [s[:name], s[:name]] }), {}, class: "w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-blue-500" %>

Create a new sandbox from an existing snapshot

<% end %> <%# Storage Options %>

Storage Options

<%= form.label :data_path, "Data Path", class: "block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1" %> <%= form.text_field :data_path, placeholder: "e.g., . (all user data) or projects/myapp", class: "w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-lg focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:border-blue-500" %>

Mount user data directory (or subpath) to /data in the sandbox

<%# Network Options %> <% if current_user.tailscale_enabled? %>

Network Options

<% end %> <%# Cleanup Options %>

Cleanup Options

<%# Actions %>
<%= link_to "Cancel", root_path, class: "text-gray-600 hover:text-gray-900" %> <%= form.submit "Create Sandcastle", class: "px-6 py-2.5 bg-blue-600 text-white font-medium rounded-lg hover:bg-blue-700 focus:ring-4 focus:ring-blue-200" %>
<% end %>

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
